intro: Rhynchosinapis pseudoerucastrum subsp. orophila, commonly known as the Sierra lily, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of western North America. It is a perennial herb with showy, cup-shaped flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in well-drained soils in open, sunny habitats such as meadows and rocky slopes. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a slightly hairy texture, while its stems are erect and sturdy. The Sierra lily is valued for its ornamental beauty and is often found in alpine and subalpine environments.
